lines.text: A public servant is the only servant who has secrets from his master.

[Referring to Simon]
I like him.
I thought you would.
I like him because he doesn't like the world. It's a good beginning.
How could you be so cruel?
I enjoyed it, my dear lady.
I'm strange, all right! I'll show you just how strange I am!
I like to listen to people who know what they're talking about. My trouble is I never believe anything they say.

[after she has lured a tourist into a mugging]
You happy in your work, Joanie?

[to Freya. Aware that his face is covered with blood]
Would you excuse my appearance? I've been sightseeing.

[to Bernard]
You know, someone once told me when a bureaucrat wants to keep his job, he stamps everything 'Top Secret.' Is that true?
I live with one fact. A power has been released that will melt these stones. We must be ready when the time comes.
You really believe it's going to happen, don't you?
Certainly! There's absolutely no question.
How old are you, Victoria?
I'm 11. We're all 11. We all have our birthdays the same week.
How long have you been here?
We've been here always.
What about your parents? Don't they come to see you?
Oh, we were hoping you were our parents.
Any bully can command obedience. Only a gentleman can command loyalty.
Whoever I am, I'm not who you think... You never even asked my name!
With a figure like that, you don't need a name!

[Talking about her sculptures]
If I could explain these I wouldn't have to make them.
Whoever I am, I'm not who you think... You never even asked my name!
With a figure like that, you don't need a name!
You know, someone once told me, that when a bureaucrat wants to keep his job, he stamps everything 'Top Secret.' Is that true?

[Coyly]
It's probably true, sometimes.
I... hate your secrets, Bernard.

[Suddenly very hesitant]
Freya, if I were to tell you... even a little *bit* about... what you call my 'secrets,'... I might be condemning you to death. Please trust my judgement.
